name: AviG2
reaction_description: AviG2 is responsible for methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 6 of the D-mannose moiety

name: AviG4
reaction_description: O-methyltransferase and is responsible for methylation of the phenolic hydroxyl group in the dichloroisoeverninic acid moiety

name: AviG6
reaction_description: AviG6 for methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 2 of the D-mannose moiety.

name: AviG5
reaction_description: methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 4 of the D-fucose moiety

name: CalO3
reaction_description: Iodination of orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A co-factor

name: CalO6
reaction_description: O-methylation of orsellenic acid, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A cofactor

name: CalO1
reaction_description: O-methylation of iodinated orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to 4'-phosphopantetheine co-factor

name: CalO2
reaction_description: Hydroxylation of iodinated orsellenic acid derivate, assumed to be bound to coenzyme A

name: MpaG
reaction_description: Catalyzes the O-methylation of demethylmycophenolic acid into mycophenolic acid

name: MtmMI
reaction_description: 4-DPMC is the first stable intermediate of the mithramycin biosynthesis. This is converted into PMC by methylation at C-4-O through the MtmMI methyltransferase in Streptomyces argillaceus

name: OxyB
reaction_description: Introduces the first crosslink (biaryl ether) between hpg4 and bht6 of the balhimycin precursor.

name: OxyC
reaction_description: Installs a biaryl ether bond on the balhiycin precursor. The reaction might be less specific than depicted in the reaction SMARTS. There is no detailed study on the specificity so far. The reaction occurs probably while the precursor peptide backbone is bound to the NRPS as shown for the closely related vancomycin biosynthesis (10.1002/ANIE.200461278).

name: BhaA
reaction_description: The halogenase chlorinates the second bht residue of the balhimycin precursor, probably while the precursor is bound to module 6 of the NRPS. The PCP domain of module 6 might be required for the reaction. The substrate specificity of the enzyme might be less specific than represented in the SMARTS pattern. In order to make the specificity not too broad structures were rather kept in the pattern than left out.

name: KtzQ
reaction_description: KtzQ is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes the chlorination of L-Trp at C7 position to yield 7-chlorotryptophan

name: KtzR
reaction_description: KtzR is a regiospecific halogenase that catalyzes chlorination at the 6-position of 7-Cl-L-Tryptophan to generate 6,7-diCl-L-Trp.

name: SfmM2
reaction_description: Mediates the methylation of tyrosine into 3-methyl-L-tyrosine (3-Me-Tyr) in biosynthesis of saframycin A

name: GtfB
reaction_description: Adds N-acetylglucosamine or N-acylglucosamine to Hpg4 of the teicoplanin aglycone. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.

name: GtfA
reaction_description: Glycosyltransferase adds N-acetylglucosamine to Bht6 of the teicoplanin precursor. Substrate specificity is probably more general than depicted in the reaction SMARTS, but there is no precise information on substrate specificity. In order to avoid making the reaction too general, the complete backbone is included in the pattern.

name: Tcp24/Orf2*/tAtf
reaction_description: Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.

name: tAtf
reaction_description: Deacetylates N-acetylglucosaminyl residue on Hpg4 of the teicoplanin precursor.

name: GtfE
reaction_description: Transfers glucose onto hpg4 in the vancomycin and teicoplanin aglycone.

name: OxyA
reaction_description: Introduces the second biaryl-ether crosslink between bht2 and hpg4 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursor. The reaction occures while the vancomycin precursor is bound to the PCP of module 6 or 7. The enzyme only accepts the chlorinated precursor.

name: Vmt
reaction_description: Methylates the N-terminus of the vancomycin backbone. Substrate specificity not known in detail. SMARTS has been designed to be not too unspecific by accident. True substrate specificity might be broader than assumed here.

name: VhaA
reaction_description: Chlorinates bht 2 and bht 6 of vancomycin. The bond to the PCP domain of module 2 of the vancomycin NRPS might be important for the reaction. There is no study on the substrate specificity for the second chlorination reaction in vancomycin biosynthesis on bht 6 so far.

name: OxyB
reaction_description: Introduces the first biaryl-ether crosslink between hpg4 and bht6 in the vancomycin and balhimycin precursors. Reaction occurs while the backbone precursor is bound to the PCP domain of module 6 or 7. The link to the PCP domain is required for the reaction.

name: GtfD
reaction_description: Transfers vancosamine onto glucose on hpg4 of vancomycin pseudoaglycone.

name: BotCYP
reaction_description: P450-catalyzed oxidative decarboxylation of terminal thiazoline of bottromycin precursor in Streptomyces sp. BC16019

name: BotOMT
reaction_description: O-methylating SAM-dependent carboxyl methyltransferase from Streptomyces sp. BC16019 - Bottromycin precursor D-Asp O-methylation

name: BotP

name: BotRMT1

name: BotCD

name: RebC
reaction_description: FAD-dependent enzyme RebC catalyse the oxidation of two carboxylic acids to form a maleimide ring. RebC cofactor is FAD.

name: TdaE
reaction_description: TdaE relies on its substrate as electron donor (rather than NAD(P)H) for O2 activation and covalent flavin-oxygen adduct formation. Then, TdaE incorporates both O2-derived oxygen atoms into the substrate most likely via transient FlN5OO and FlN5O species, thereby breaking the CoA thioester bond and epoxidizing the tropone ring.

name: MdpB1

name: PokMT1
